awesomeslizer1216,"2010-11-21T16:57:12.323Z","Nice!","Pros:
- I really like the cobra! Maybe it's just me though.
- Few stickers! They're kinda annoying.
- I like the jeep, perfect for an epic drive and gun getaway.
column2:
Cons:
- I think it could've included a few more functions for a $30 dollar set, much like the Space Police 3 Space Truck Getaway set, it is really cool looking but it doesn't have any real set functions like flick and fire missiles.
- I think it could've had one more mummy. It is Pharaoh's Quest which is all about mummies.

Overall:
I had a great time playing with it! I thought the build was simple enough and fun, like two stickers and the truck and cobra are awesome! I found the little building thing kind of pointless but it had it's uses. I like the scarab shield and I would say it's a good set to get!
",TRUE,4,5,5,4,4

UFO_and_Insectoids,"2011-01-09T21:24:52.62Z","The Golden Scarab!","

Another great addition to this new and AWESOME Lego theme. This set includes many great new pieces such as the golden scarab shield, the cobra head, and the mummy's headdress with the detailed snake design.
Here are the pros and cons
Pros:
-Cool minifigures including the mummy snake charmer!
-Cool and detailed cobra guardian that detaches from pillar!
-Includes car and one of the 6 treasures, the golden scarab sheild!
Cons:
-None, other then it doesn't contain any features or traps.
Overall: 5/5! A great addition to the Lego Pharaohs Quest collection!

legospongepotter,"2011-01-31T20:28:27.12Z","Fear the Serpent!","Another excellent set for the new Pharaoh's Quest theme. This is my set, and my largest. I also own Scarab Attack and Golden Staff Guardians, both reviews are on Brickset. This set is very unique, and the snake is a great part. You get three Minifigures who I will proudly reveal now.&nbsp
column2: <div>(I'm splitting this into sections: Minifigures, Jeep,&nbsp
column3:
Accessories, Monument, Snake, and a Quick Review I do with larger sets.)

Minifigures:

Okay, so like I said, there are three Minifigures: Jake Raines, Helena Tova, and a Snake Charmer Mummy.
column4: Jake Raines - Jake Raines is the leader of the 'good guys' in Pharaoh's Quest. He's a very interesting Minifigure. He has messy black hair that is getting more common and can be seen in sets like the Camper. He has a yellow head with cool
column6: on each side of his face. He has some aftershave and a small triangular beard. He's got a determined eyes, a half-smiling mouth, and a red scratch on the right side of his face.&nbsp
column7:
Jake has a tan jacket on with buttons and a white shirt with an undone collar. He has a brown belt with a silver buckle and a sort of sash with bullets on it, like a bullet holder. I don't know what to call it. He has some back-printing, which consists of the back of his tan jacket. the back of the bullet sash which has a silver buckle, and the back of his belt where you can see some small containers in it, like Batman. He has dark tan legs

Helena Tova - I believe she is the only female character in Pharaoh's Quest. I noticed Minifigures are normally male, but there are a decent amount of females. Anyway, she's a really cool Minifigure. She has reddish-brown Agent hair that is the same color of any of the Weasleys in Harry Potter. It parts on either side of his face and runs along her back in a long ponytail. My only complaint is that it fall of often. Her yellow head is double-sided. On one side she looks
column8: determined. She has pink lipstick. on the other side she is afraid and her teeth are showing. It looks like she's shivering or something.&nbsp
column9: Her torso is pretty cool. She has a necklace with a blue gemstone on it (reminds me of the jewel in 'Flying Mummy Attack') and a white shirt, with a neat collar and it is buttoned. She also has a brown belt with a silver buckle. It has various compartments. On the back you simply see the back of her belt and some lines for her shirt. She has a light tan satchel which hangs from her shoulder and extends to her waist and is made to look like a real bag. It is my first bag like this and it is very cool. Her arms are white bu her hands are brown, like gloves, which is pretty cool. She has black pants.
column10: Snake Charmer Mummy - He's my favorite Minifigure. He has the basic mummy outfit with gray skin, He's wearing another cool headdress that extends like a ponytail in the back and has room for one stud up front in the middle, and part of it goes to his shoulders and hangs off them. It is a new tan color so
column14: better, there are two green snake designs on it. His head is bandaged.&nbsp
column15: completely. He is double-sided, so on one side you can see only a red eye, on the other you can see both eyes, his mouth, and his teeth.&nbsp
column16: His torso is also heavily bandaged everywhere so it looks kind of dirty. near his neck is some kind of gold cloth or whatever with dark blue designs. On the back it is generally the same. He has dark gray hands in contrast to his light gray skin. He has light gray legs and it looks like he's wearing these blue robes that stop near his knees. The robes look ripped.
column17:
Now that the Minifigures are done, now I will continue with the jeep you get.

Jeep

Every single Pharaoh's Quest set comes with a rust red vehicle, with the exception of Scarab Attack, the smallest set which is an impulse set. Like I said, the majority of the jeep is rust red and it is a very cool vehicle. Up front there is a couple headlights and a
column18: license plate reading 'LC 3957'. On top of the hood is just one smooth piece. Then you get your front window with two lights flanking it.&nbsp
column19:
Now, the seating is pretty cool. It is made of two seats and it is one piece. The doors do not open. There is a black steering wheel in there. As we continue to move back,there is this little piece that has a design of what looks like a rope. In the very back there is a very cool brown crate that has 6 studs in it, but it takes eight to fit it on there. You can put Helena in there. On either side of the awesome crate are two holders. One has a gray rifle and the other has a black shovel. The wheels are pretty big and look heavy duty. The truck is my favorite of the two Pharaoh's Quest vehicles I have, the other being the motorcycle in 'Golden Staff Guardians.' One Minifigure can fit in this jeep easily, but it's a little tight with two.

Accessories:

There are lots of great accessories in this set.
column20: Pistol (x2) - Helena gets a standard pirates pistol. It is gray. You get as a extra piece which I thought was great.
column21: Dynamite - You get a bright red stick of dynamite.
column22:
Green Snakes (x2) - These are for the Mummy. I thought they were great. They are basically normal curvy snakes but green. And then you get two. I think they act as weapons for the Mummy. Very cool.

Rifle - I already mentioned this. It is just the standard gray rifle. It is quite long and pretty cool. I think there is one in every PQ set, but I may be wrong.
column23: Shovel - This is a normal black shovel with a flat end. I think there are some in Farmer sets (a sub-theme of City).
column24:
Monument:

This is where the Mummy stands, and this holds the large snake. It is reasonably large itself. On the bottom is some tan pieces and some black pieces to block out the inside. There is some
column25: hieroglyphics. Above there is a small platform that fits a Minifigure. A couple slants pieces flank the platform and in between is a pillar with some&nbsp
column26:
hieroglyphics, which are stickers. As you move up you see the point of the set.
In this set, Jake
column28: and Helena Tova and trying to get the Golden Scarab Shield from the Mummy. It is a normal Scarab shield with lots of detail like a handle in the back, but it is bright gold. Then there is some dark blue pieces and a cool gold piece that tops the monument in a point.&nbsp
column29:
Snake:

The snake is the obvious feature of the set. It is pretty long. One and a half of the snakes are the length of my arm. I'll start at the bottom and then end with the top.
column30: There is these long tan tail-like pieces that don't even look like Lego.Then it continues in a chain. There are two types of links. There is a small part that has some gold pieces, and then large part with gold pieces, dark blue, tan, and a rusty orange. I would like to note printing on certain pieces. The gold pieces that are sort of slanted but have room at the &nbsp
column31: top have dark printing that looks like a V. It's on all of them, but not very&nbsp
column33: The chain continues and then hits the head. It has a printed piece with some eyes. The snake looks like a girl because of the eyes. The printing looks like bricks. Inside the mouth you can see the tong which comes out of the mouth and it looks like a fork. It has two white fangs. The bottom jaw moves up and down a little. Then there is that big part that sticks out and looks like ears (sorry, i forgot what you call it). It is normal plastic, not regular Legos and attaches easily. It is on there pretty firmly. It has a cool design of tan and dark blue stripes and very big tan circles. which connect at the bottom in a line. In between the two circles is some
column37: piece on the back of the monument. However, it falls of easily do I don't really like the design there.&nbsp
column38:
Cursed Cobra Statue Quick Review

I do this with bigger sets with long reviews. This is for those who want to read a review fast.

This set is very cool. It is the third biggest Pharaoh's Quest set. It comes with three Minifigures.

Jake Raines is the first. He has black hair and some cool sideburns. His torso has a white shirt and tan jacket. He also has light tan legs.

Helena Tova is second. She has orange Agents hair and is double-sided. She is determined on one side and scared on the other. She gets a pistol and dynamite.
column39:
The Mummy is third. He has a tan headdress with green snake designs. He has the normal mummy outfit, so he's all bandaged up. He comes with two green snakes. He is double sided. One side shows his whole face, the other just one eye.

The set comes with a red jeep that has some good seating up front and a black steering wheel, then a crate in the back that can fit some stuff. It has two holders, a gun and shovel.

It comes with a big monument that some
column40: hieroglyphics and a platform for the Mummy. The large snake attaches to it because of a&nbsp
column42:
piece in the back. It also holds the golden scarab shield

The snake has a chain for most of his body with lots of good detail. The head is printed with some eyes. He has white fangs and a forked tongue. His head moves up and down.


Overall

Thanks for reading this review. This set obviously is required because of the shield to any Pharaoh's Quest fan. I like this set and think it's really cool. I can't wait to get my next set. I plan on getting all the sets next month but who knows?

column1:
cadwindu1996,"2011-02-19T02:20:12.683Z","the cobra is alive!","

Ok well i have to say this set blew me away
column2: with awesome minfigs an awesome snake and a jeep it has excellent value for money I actually recieved this as a gift for doing work experience at tesco hythe in colchester by tesco which was very cool.&nbsp

column1: Box/InstructionsParts

The box had some very cool images on front and back and excellent cloth like details to make it look like a map. the instructions were the averedge size of an instruction manual for a 20-30 pound set and had just over 48 pages. the peices were very nice and came in five bags they were not numbered though.I did notice a new peice for the front of the car where the headlights and number plate go.
Minifigures

jake raines:Ok this is my first jake raines figure ever and i have to say seeing him for myself he is a fantastic hero and well worthy of the title of action hero for the theme.He has a double sided torso and tan trousers both sides of the torso have amazing detail.
column2: I hope lego continues with this double sided feel for all of 2011 sets. His hair is cool because the only sets you can get black spiky hair in without paying loads is the collectable minifigures series 1 and 2 so it is easy to get if you get raines. if you get a spare raines in perhaps scarab attack you can put his head on a tux body to give him an indy feel.

column1: Helen tova/skvalling?:Ok i just want to clear this up she is only refered to as tova in
column2: the description of the set on lego.com however every where else she is skvalling so i will just refer to her as helen.She has excellent detail on both sides of the torso and carries a light tan indiana jones satchel however i think hers is more acurate to the indiana jones movies.She comes with a pistol and can be given dynamite she has black legs and earth orange&nbsp
column3: hair like obi wan's but in the style of the collectable minfigure lifeguard's hair.She also has a scared face and a determined face.

column1: mummy snake guy:He is basically the same mummy from the other set golden staff guardians with added snake head dress which is awesomely detailed and two green snakes from the indiana jones set well of souls.
The build
Quite an easy build until you get to the snake but even that isn't that hard you just have to follow instructions 8 times over to make the body and tail then the head is very simple.
The completed model

the completed model looks very cool especially combined with golden staff guardians the snake poised over the statue ready to pounce on the intruders the mummy holding his snakes poised to throw them and the adventurers walking or rather driving into a Trap.However one complaint snake does hot fit into the statue very well and is quite loose apart from that set is fine.
Summary

Overall an excellent set and a definate recommend to others get this et or you will regret it!

",TRUE,5,4,5,5,5

K_nut,"2011-02-27T08:50:53.783Z","The worst Pharaohs Quest set, but still pretty good."," When I picked this set up at TRU, I was excited because I thought that it would be very playable. I went home, built it, and was sort of
column2:
disappointed.

Minifigs

The minifigs are
column3: possibly the best part of this set. Jake Raines, we've seen him before so I don't really need to go into much detail there. Helena Skavling is a great figure and her torso can basically fit into all themes. Unlike the picture here on brickset, her hands are brown instead of yellow, and in my opinion, they look much better. The snake charmer mummy is just like any other mummy, with the&nbsp
column5: face. The only unique part about him is his&nbsp
column6:
headdress. His headdress is dark tan and has a nice, simple pattern of a snake on it.

Car

The car is very good but awkward looking. If you look at it closely, the front and back seem to stick out a little too far. The color scheme on all the Pharaohs Quest vehicles have that nice, rugged feel to them.

Pyramidy, Statue thing

I really don't know what to call this, but it does look kind of neat. It is a great stander for the snake. The shield looks very cool in gold color.

Snake

The snake is the worst part of this set. It is good for parts, but impossible to pose. It's very knobbly and only falls over when not on the pyramidy, statue thing. When on it, it has much more
column7:
poseability.

Overall

This is definitely the worst of the Pharaohs Quest sets, besides the coin bank of course. Overall, it is pretty good looking when it sits next to other Pharaohs Quest sets, but is very hard to play with the snake. It is much smaller then it looks on the box. If you're a collector like me, you should get this but if not, you still should get it

column1:
Hobie819,"2012-03-23T19:28:28.177Z","Saw this on clearance - couldn't pass it up and not disappointed","

I found this set on clearance at the local BX (military base exchange).
column2: They typically always have a few sets on clearance (50% off) so this one was up when I went in today.

column1:
Box/Instructions

The box and instructions are par for the course. As with most newer models the instructions show on the top of the page what parts are used in the steps
column2: There was a small misprint with the box as others have noted in that the box shows Helena's hands as a different color but nothing major.

column1:
Parts

There are a lot of unique parts to this set as well as parts to use for later models. Yeah, the stickers suck but there weren't too many to put on (2 for the car, 2 for the statue). The main thing that confused me was the mix between printed parts and stickers. Some printed parts suprised me (the snakes head for instance where it is only used in this model) while more common parts such as the hieroglyphics were stickers.

Minifigures

Both figures are nice.
column2: Nothing super special with any of them but the hair on Helena is a pretty nice hair style for the figures thnat I didn't have before.

column1:
The build

Very repetitive... I didn't expect anything less considering you're building a giant snake but there also wasn't anything that stood out at me or gave me any ideas for future builds.
column2: It was pretty strait forward.&nbsp
column3: If you're looking for simple then the set is for you.

column1:
The completed model

The completed model is pretty nice.
column2: My main suggestion for improvement would be to change the blue connector in the back of the tower to be a full connector instead of the x connector to the snake. This would allow the snake to stay on the tower easier for poses and whatnot.&nbsp
column3: The playability factor is great - my 3 year old son (who also loves LEGO's) has bene playing with it since we built it.&nbsp
column4: If you are a true AFOL (one that doesn't ""play"" with their models much), the tower offers a good stand for the snake to pose giving the model a nice display look to it.

column1:
Summary

In reality I couldn't complain much about it. I got the set for 15 US dollars which is an outstanding price per brick and the playability will keep my son and I entertained for awhile.
column2:
Add this to our Indiana Jones theme legos and the few ones I had from the original adventure series and we have a fairly nice middle east treasure hunting scene to play with.

",TRUE,4,5,4,5,4

column1:
KLOKRIECHER,"2012-02-23T10:38:26.45Z","LEGO Pharaoh's Quest - Cursed Cobra Statue Review","

This is a fun set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 52 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has a lot of great pieces which are very useful for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms for sure. This set has a lot of tan and 'fake gold' pieces, too.

Minifigures

The minifigs look very cool. The mummy has two green snakes and a nice looking hood. The back of the face and the torso are printed. The other figure we get is Jake Raines. It's a cool character but I like Johnny Thunder from the old LEGO Adventurers theme more. The figure has some cool markings on the front and on the back of his torso. The last minifig we get is Helena Tova. She looks very hot for a minifig and I like the hair piece which LEGO has given her. On the back on the torso and on the face we can also see some printings.

The build

The build was very fun and easy and we also get a few stickers to put on. This set took me 22 minutes and 31 seconds.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7325-1.jpg[/img]


This set has a lot of cool stuff in it: We get a jeep, a huge snake and a statue which is the stand for the snake. On the statue we can also see a golden scarab piece which the explorers have to get. The head and the tail of the snake can be adjusted very easily as well. The head of the snake is printed for my surprise and the mouth can be opened and closed, too. The jeep looks great as well. I love the colors on it and it's also nice to see that LEGO uses the cockpit piece which we've seen on a lot of those vehicles from the old LEGO Adventurers theme before. I really can't complain anything abbout this set.

Summary

All
in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get
this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.
Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set
on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
column2:
>Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

Challenge

",TRUE,4,3,5,4,4

column1:
BTZ4435,"2011-12-25T11:12:30.437Z","Not bad","

This set is pretty good.
Pros

• Pro-No Stickers for the plastic piece of the snake
  • Pro-Big car
  • Pro-Good pharaoh headdress
  • Pro-Snake is big, it is like a $20 set by itself
  • Pro-VERY simple to build, a lot of the same, easy thing for the body

• Con-Not the correct hands to the picture in front of instruction manual
  • Con-Mini snakes are hard to hold in hands
  • Con-Shield hard to remove from the statue



Overall, I say this is a decent set. I would recommend this to a Lego fan anywhere!

,TRUE,4,3,5,5,5 AETerry","2012-01-27T14:11:13.3Z","Cursed Cobra Statue Review","

The whole of the Pharaoh's Quest line is a revisit to the older Adventurers theme LEGO did many years ago, mainly the Desert Sub-theme of that series. And frankly, I rather like this series and much of the feel of this theme.

Box/Instructions

The instructions are in booklet form with illustrated step-by-step pictures of the build, followed by a catalog of pieces in the set in case of needing to reorder or replace missing pieces.

Parts

At 213 pieces, the set doesn't feel it's worth the $29.99 in some ways. Like it falls a bit short. I'd say it's worth it though for many of the ball joints in this set for those looking for those style of pieces for other MOCs.

It also seems inconsistant to have a printed brick for the cobra's head and stickers that are placed on the obelisk and car.

Minifigures

You get three minifigures. That of Jake Rains, Helena Tova and a Mummy.

The build and completed model

The set is built in three parts.

1st - Jeep - Jake and Helena's car that they use to get away from the snake. The build is fairly standard and offers some good color choices of that dark burgundy for the jeep.

2nd - Obelisk - while it's not too exciting a build, it provides something for the cobra statue to rest on and a repository for the gold scarab shield that the Mummy is guarding.

3rd - Cobra Statue - While much of this build is repetitive for the different segments, the final build of the snake is pretty solid. There's a thin, almost paper-like plastic for the Cobra's hood. Otherwise you have a good build that clearly looks like what it's supposed to be.

Summary

As stated above, I rather like this theme and have enjoyed collecting up the sets for it. Very Indiana Jones like or the newer series with Brandon Frasier of The Mummy. I am glad that LEGO opted for focusing on doing a few well done sets rather than cranking out numerous sets and designs just to milk it for tired, redone models. All of the Pharaoh's Quest sets stand out on their own from other Adventurer sets.

",TRUE,4,5,4,5,4

wander099,"2011-04-13T22:55:12.653Z","Awesome looking cobra, less awesome set...","

This was the set that initially drew my attention to the Pharaoh's Quest theme.
column2: Naturally, I had to have it and I think I will end up with all the sets except for the really big pyramid one (I hate the baseplate...a lot).

column1:
Box/Instructions

The box art is really great.
column2: It makes this set, in my opinion, the most visually appealing.&nbsp
column3: I just loved how the snake looked.&nbsp
column4: The instructions consisted of a single booklet and the bags were not numbered-par for the course on a set this size and of this complexity.

column1:
Parts

There are some really great parts in this set.
column2: The most obvious one is the large thin plastic piece attached to the cobra.&nbsp
column3: The plastic is thicker and more sturdy than I expected, this is not something that will accidentally rip one day if you treat it well.&nbsp
column4: The cobra's upper jaw is also printed (unfortunately the pieces of the pillar are not, but I'll get to that later).&nbsp
column5: This set also comes with the old vehicle body in dark red as well as the many gold pieces used for the cobra.&nbsp
column6: And of course there is the golden scarab shield.

column1:
Minifigures

You get three with this set: Jake Raines (the exact same one AGAIN!), Helena Tova, and a snake-charmer mummy.
column2:
Jake is nothing special, the same figure is included in two other sets, including the Scarab Attack set, so if you're just after him, just buy the cheap one.

However, this is the only set that includes Helena Tova, so she is a good reason to buy this set if you are a fan of the theme and want all the characters.
column3: Her hands are brown for some reason (unlike pictures on the box) and from what I hear that is true across the board.&nbsp
column4: I don't know if Lego just made a mistake in making her or if they just forgot to change the box after altering the colour.&nbsp
column5:
All in all, she's a cool figure, she's got a printed torso and a cool shoulder bag that I didn't have in my collection before.

Finally, the mummy.
column6: Compared to the ones in other sets, this one is just alright.&nbsp
column7: He's got the same head, torso, and legs.&nbsp
column8: The only difference is that his headdress has a couple of snakes painted on it and he comes with two green snakes to wave around.&nbsp
column9: Compared to the flying mummies I got in one of the other sets, this one just doesn't measure up.

column1:
The build

The build was pretty easy, and when it got to the body of the snake, it was repetitive.
column2: And there were a bunch of stickers for the pillar as well as the vehicle.&nbsp
column3: Some of them, particularly the ones for the car, were a pain to get into place.&nbsp
column4: I really dislike the plentiful stickers in this theme.

column1:
The completed model

Overall, the model is pretty good.
column2: I love the way the snake can be posed on the pillar and made to attack the adventurers as they try to get the shield.&nbsp
column3: The snake is kind of hard to pose though and is really limited when posed separate from the pillar (will fall down a lot if you aren't careful how you pose it!)&nbsp
column4: And I think it would have looked better if the pillar was taller .&nbsp
column5: I am not so crazy about the car.&nbsp
column6: Visually, it is fine, but practically, there is an issue because you cannot fit both adventurers in the car at the same time.&nbsp
column7: The second figure must be placed standing in the crate at the back, which is somewhat annoying since the car could have been made to fit both.

column1:
Summary

In short, this set looks a whole lot better than it is.
column2: I would recommend this set only if you are a fan of the theme or really want the snake.&nbsp
column3: It is a bit pricey for what it includes and unless you really want all the characters from the theme or you really like the snake, it just isn't worth the money.&nbsp
column4: I suspect that younger children would really like this set, but for older children and adults, it is less attractive and you should only buy it if you are really sure you want it.&nbsp
column5:
Personally, it goes well with my Temple of Anubis from the old adventurer's theme (as do many of the other sets in this theme), so that could be another reason to get it if you own some of those old sets.

",TRUE,4,5,3,4,3

column1:
xccj,"2011-03-09T23:54:56.32Z","The Minifigures are Great, and the Cobra is Just a Supporting Role","

The new Pharaoh's Quest theme is a fun concept that hasn't been seen since Johnny Thunder, and the Cursed Cobra set fits the theme nicely.
column2: It comes with a couple of explorers, a nice vehicle, and a big, Egyptian-style enemy.

column1: The minifigures are the main appeal to this set.
column2: They have lots of nice detail, particularly Helena.&nbsp
column3: The truck itself looks pretty swell, even though the build isn't spectacular.&nbsp
column4: The cobra is okay but certainly not the best enemy out there.&nbsp
column5: The head design is great, but the sockets that make up the rest of the body make it hard to pose.&nbsp
column6: Although, to be fair, that's pretty much guaranteed for any snake model.&nbsp
column7: And the temple is really only there to support the cobra.

column1: If the role playing just isn't enough, then the parts selection is really great.
column2: There are some neat recolored pieces, as well as lots of tan, dark tan, and gold elements.&nbsp
column3: Plus, the minifigure parts make it all worth it.

column1:
It's a little pricey for what it contains, but if it can be found on sale, then it's certainly worth it.

",TRUE,4,5,4,5,4

vith,"2011-03-28T14:55:46.37Z","This got me back into Lego...","

So, one day I was at the local toy shop, don't ask me why but I feel I had to take a look at the new Lego sets. I'm 20 years old now (hehe). And I parted, after a long debate with this set. (The other choice was brickbeard's bounty, but that wouldn't fit on my bookshelves.)


So I came home after a twenty-minute busride and I immediately began, just like the old days unpacking the set on the carpet, in front of the television.

Aaaah the joy I had...
Pros

• Great fun to build
  • Wow, it's a bloody snake!
  • Oh my, the minifigures are cool
  • The car is really nice
Cons

• The little temple is a bit too little (but you buy the set for the snake anyway)
  • This got me back into Lego. *sigh*


At around 32 EUR, you'll get a scary serpent, a sexy mummy armed with two green snakes and a jeep with two heroes in it. It's, as always a bit expensive but hey.. It's a toy that will last forever.

",TRUE,4,5,5,4,3
